resources.string: "A material metaphor is the unifying theory of a rationalized space and a system of motion. " "\nThe material is grounded in tactile reality, inspired by the study of paper and ink, yet technologically advanced and open to imagination and magic."

Technospandan is the annual technical, cultural and sports fest of UIET, CSJMU, Kanpur. It is a three day extravaganza which has students from different colleges participating in various out of the box events. Firstly, Technical Events are designed in such a way that it not only motivates students to think differently but also learn how to tackle real life situations. Then, we will also be having cultural events to lighten up the atmosphere.
If you liked the app, feel free to contact me.
I Would Be Very Grateful If You Could Donate Me !
Thanks For Your Donations, I Am Very Grateful !

"Air Strike" - Since the first Flight ever taken by mankind on 1903 Flying machines have evolved beyond any pinions to hold them down. We have superior mechanics ,superior motors ,superior speeds ,superior controls, superior thrills and even superior challenges to face. Worthy enough for the Pilots who engage in this activity are sometimes called crazy daredevils. TechnoSpandan 18 provides you to fall in love with this physically and mentally challenging sport that takes years to learn and a lifetime to master.The competition acts as a platform to compete by performing different manoeuvres and showing their talent in flying dead stick flight, spot landing and of course, mid-air control!


Registration Fees – Rs 300 including workshop.

 Coordinator Harshit Verma (CSE) 9696621616

 Avinash Tripathi (CSE) 7754884497


Venue: OAT

 Workshop:


Date 20-21 march Time 10am to 2pm

Engineering is not merely knowing and being knowledgeable, like a walking encyclopedia; engineering is not merely analysis; engineering is not merely the possession of the capacity to get elegant solutions to non-existent engineering problems; engineering is practicing the art of the organized forcing of technological change... Engineers operate at the interface between science and society...” - Dean Gordon Brown One of the biggest engineering problems is to connect people, to overcome physical obstructions and topographical boundaries for proper development of our society. Bridges provide the structural solution to all these problems, guaranteeing safest and easiest link between two parts through most adverse conditions like rivers, canopies, oceans, trenches and much more. Bridges are essential to our nation"s infrastructural development. Here at TechnoSpandan we provide you a platform to showcase your innovation, creativity, knowledge, and ability to tackle practical problems. 



No of participants per team – 4 

 Registration Fees – Rs 40 per head

 Event Structure: The event will be conducted in 3 stages 

 1. Written Test: Time – 45 minutes Total marks – 30 In written test only two members of a team are allowed. Test will contain questions related to basic mechanics, history of different bridges and aptitude 8 teams will qualify for next round 

 2. Construction of bridge : The bridge is to be made by the materials provided Duration : 3 hours (max.) Venue : Below L1 

 3. Testing of Bridge : Finally the bridge will be tested in judged by faculty members. The bridge design which bears all the applied load wins.

 
 Coordinator Mohd Afzal (9565045929) 

 Shubhendra Singh Bhadauriya (9450553257) 

 Amit Kannaujia (7355481135) 

 Priyesh Singh (8874398822)

This time it’s going to be more ferocious, more aggressive and more deadly. Build the Machines that can brutally demolish your enemy and show your robotic acumen, blend your intellect and fighter instinct, controlling skill. Task: 

 Design and construct a manually controlled wired or wireless robot that can destroy the bots of your opponents or can throw their bots out of the arena.

 Robot Specifications:

 1. The bot should completely fit in a box of dimensions 45cm X 40cm X 30cm (l X b X h) at the start of each round. The size of external controller used to control the machine is not included in this size constraint. 

 2. The maximum weight of the robot can be 13 kg. 

 3. The bot can be controlled by a wireless or a wired remote. 

 4. In case of a wired remote, the robot should have a pipe supporting the wires, so that the wires are not damaged by opponent bot. Minimum height of the pipes needs to be 60cm from the ground. The wires should be of sufficient length to cover the arena. 

 5. In case of wireless remote, the power supply should be on the bot itself. 

 6. The power supply on the bot will be counted in its weight. 

 7. Maximum voltage used by robot is 36 volts. 

 8. Bot can use any kind of magnetic weapons, spinning weapons, cutters, flippers, saws, lifting devices, spinning hammers , metal contraptions with spikes, circular saws, maces, cutters, flippers, drills, hammer, metallic armor and shield, high power magnet and electro -magnet, etc. 

 Arena: 

 1. The size of the square arena (grey color) is 8ft*8ft (l X b). 

 2. The arena will have walls of height 20cm and their will be gates in between each wall. The length of the gates wills 5ft. 

 3. The height of stage is 15cm and length breath is 90*55(l*b). 


Game Play: 

 1. The most important rule is destroy the opponent bot. 

 2. The competition will be a knockout tournament consisting of elimination and finals. 

 3. There is two round of 4-4 min. 

 4. Two bots will compete with each other in each round. 

 5. Each round can last maximum of 4 minutes. 

 6 . The bots will try to either push the opponent bot out of the arena through gates or pit, or immobilize the opponent bot.

 7. he weapon will be used after 2 minutes in first round and after 1 minute in second round.

 General Rules: 

 1. Participants are not allowed to put anything inside the arena other than the bot. 

 2. In case of any disputes/discrepancies the organizers decision will be final and binding.

 3. The organizers reserve the rights to change any or all of the above rules as they deem fit. Change in rules, if any will be highlighted on the website and notified to the registered teams. 

 4. The team will first reach on the stage and push the block down in the hole in middle they will get 40 points. 

 5. If any bot will push the bot down the stage then they will get 20 points. 

 6. If any bot push another bot out of the arena then they will get 60 points. 

 7. Points will be given by the organizers on the basis of aggression, damage, control and strategy. 

 8. A robot will be considered immobilize if it does not display any linear movement for 30 seconds then they will get 60 points.


Registration Free : Rs 350 / team. Participation:

 1. A team may consist of maximum 6 members and min 4.

 2. Students from different educational institutes can form a team. 

 3. All students with a valid identity card of their respective educational institutes are eligible to participate. 


Coordinator: • Rahul Maurya (MEE) 8808767501 

 • Pratigya Jaiswal (MEE) 

 • Atul Yadav (MEE) 8317078435 

 • Pratigya Jaiswal(MEE))

Construct a racing bot (wired/wireless) which can compete against the opponent bot while traversing through the arena full of sharp turns, rough paths, undulations and zig-zag paths and wedges, etc. And Luck shall favour the bravest.


Registration Free : 300 / team. 

 RULES and REGULATIONS: ∙ Maximum Members in a team : 5 ∙ Each member from same college is mandatory ∙ The robot should follow the robot specifications provided. Any deviation from the mentioned specifications will lead to disqualification. ∙ Once the race begins maximum 4 hand touches are allowed and on using those you have to start from the last check point. ∙ Only DC motors can be used, maximum 12V for each motor. ∙ The arena may subject to change before the commencement of any round. ∙ The decision of the coordinators will be final and abiding in case of any dispute.

 ROBOT SPECIFICATIONS : ∙ Dimensions : 25×25×25 ( in cms)[max] 20×20×20(in cms)[min] ∙ Net weight should not exceed 4kgs. ∙ A tolerance of 5% is acceptable. ∙ Wired or wireless robots are allowed.

 GENERAL RULES : ∙ The structure of the robot should not be changed during the competition. ∙ During the game play , if any part of a robot is destructed\dismantled\damaged the participant will be given a time out to repair at an expense of a penalty. ∙ If the robot by chances falls from the bridge, the robot will be kept back to the previous checkpoint crossed with a penalty. ∙ No readjustment is allowed during the run. ∙ Hand , robot enmesh and robot fall all penalties will be announced at the time of event. ∙ Arena will be released at the time of event.

 COORDINATORS : Rahul gaur (MEE) 8439695289

 Anand Patel (MEE) 8931918550 

Anurag Singh (ECE) 9616480578 

Supriya pal (MEE)

Hovercrafts fascinate everyone, Don’t they..?? So interested in making one of those balancing models capable of moving on water as well as land...This is your event, people!! So get the ball rolling design enthusiasts and let"s see who designs the Ultimate hovercraft and takes away the coveted prize. 


Team Members – 4 members per team 

 Registration Fees – 160 per team The event will be conducted in only one round. The participants have to lift the hovercraft and take it on a straight path. The participants will be given a workshop before the event so that they can get an idea about how to make the hovercraft After teams have showcased the hovercraft in action , a viva will take place by judges. The team that secures the highest marks wins. Also the participants must keep the cost of the hovercraft as nominal as possible.

 Coordinators • Anurag Singh (MEE) 8574371923 

 • Rainy Prajapati (MEE) 

 • Mansi Singh (CHE) 

 • Shivam Kumar (MEE) 8009637094

Unleash the chemwizard inside you to the full potential and let yourself spell free. Use your logical ions to conduct yourself to the prize. TechnoSpandan 18 gives you an opportunity to brush up your Chemistry skills and indulge yourself in this Ultimate Battle of Chemistry Wizards.


Registration Fee : 120 per group One group has maximum 2 or 3 members

 Day 1 : Quiz will be conducted of 50 marks, in which maximum questions will be based on chemistry and the rest will be on aptitude.

 Day 2 : Qualified groups will present a paper presentation on a chosen topic in front of the judges. Marks will be distributed on different parameters.

 Venue : Chemical Department

 Coordinator: • Somya Srivastava (CHE)

 • Chandra Prakash (CHE) 8574203925

CodeTrex is a competitive programming contests which aims at testing participant"s problem solving skills and knowledge of algorithms. Participants will have to write source code of computers programs which can solve given challenges within given time constraints. Mere knowledge of algorithms would not be enough. Contestants will have to design their solutions using ideas from existing algorithms which would match the complexity of given problems.


Event Structure: It is a multi round event , in which 1st round is a quiz round where student are judged on the basis of basic knowledge of computer fundamentals and c programming. For every wrong answer there would be negative marking . Selection of students for 2nd round would be based on their marks scored in the 1st round . 2nd round is a programming contest which aims at testing participant’s problem solving skills and knowledge of algorithms . Winner will be decided on the basis of their performance in the 2nd round.


Rounds : Event has two rounds.

 No of participants :Team of two members.

 Difficulty: Difficulty level for 1st and 2nd year students is different.

 Registration Fees:₹ 30/- participant. Prize money depends on number of participation.

 Duration of contest:

 • For round 1- 1hour (Day 1) • For round 2-1hour 30 min (Day 2)


Coordinators: • Shubhi Verma (CSE)

 • Shivangi Gupta (CSE)

 • Shubham Verma (CSE) 9457913530

 • Rudra Ghosh (CSE)

App-Athon is aimed to invent, design and develop applications. This challenge opens doors to the participants for creative innovation by deploying knowledge about programming and design through an Android/iOS app or an Obj-c/Swift/Java module. This event is a perfect opportunity to give wings to your crazy ideas. App-Athon challenges you on speed, ingenuity and innovation.


• Students have to create android or iOS based application based on the theme of our fest or any other great idea.

 • They will be given a time of 14 days for this.

 • Team of 3

 • Open to all

 • Top 3 applications will be hosted on a server and will also be presented in the inauguration.


Registration Free : Rs 50 / team.

 Coordinators:

 Vedant (CSE) +91 95575 87232

 Chhaya Gupta (IT)

 Shweta (CSE) 9695084650

Ever dreamt of having a mini-rocket of your own? If yes, TechnoSpandan" 18 brings to you a thrilling opportunity to make your own water rockets and see them fly high! It"s high time to design and construct your water propelled rocket pressurized with air and compete with surging excitement in MOMENTUM, the water rocket event of TechnoSpandan. Let"s keep the momentum high and give thrust to our innovation to take a lead in this event!


Event Structure: It is a multi round event , in which 1st round is hitting the target round where student are judged and marked on the basis of the performance of hitting the best position on target . Selection of students for 2nd round would be based on their marks scored in the 1st round .

 2nd round is a time of flight round where contestants are judged on the basis of minimum time of flight of parachute . Winner will be decided on the basis of their performance in the 2nd round.

 Rounds:This Event has two rounds.

 No of participants:Team of 3 to 4 members.

 Registration Fees :Registration charges are ₹ 40/- per head. • Prize money depends on number of participation.

 Duration of contest. • For round 1st - 2hour (Day 1) • For round 2nd - 1hour 30 min (Day 2)

 Coordinators :- Swastik Sharma(IT) 8417883089 

Saumya Singh (IT) Nitin Suman (MEE) 8299189747

 Harshvardhan (CSE)

"Line Following Robot"

 "Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower."-Steve Jobs. Your task is to build an autonomous robot which is the hope for human survival in the time of catastrophe. The bot must travel through an ancient maze to reach the mystical grids and identify the symbols hidden in these grids as they are crucial for survival. Come into the Arena and show them who is the BOSS.

 Registration Fee : 550 per head (for those who register for workshop) , 50 per head ( for those who don"t attend workshop) LFR workshop will be provided. Date for workshop is 17 and 18 March, 2018

 Team members : 4 ( Max.)

 Event Structure: LFR will be conducted in two rounds 1st round will be a qualifying round. Participants will move their robot along the line thorough the arena. The teams that finish in less time qualify for the next round. 2nd round will be the final round. Participants will be judged on the basis of time and how they tackle the obstacles. The team that finishes in least time wins.

 Venue: Below L1

 Coordinators: • Harshit Verma (CSE) 9696621616

 • Shubhanshu Verma (CSE) 8574965908

 • Saumya Sonkar (IT)

 • Poonam Nishad (IT)

"If you are going to make a living in defense, you have to think like the offense"

 Crypto gives you an opportunity to solve information and security related problems in a safe environment with reduced consequences for activities generally considered malicious or illegal. There will be problems related to assorted fields of computer security and hacking ranging from cryptography, cryptanalysis and steganography. So put on your eye-patches and get ready to explore the field of computer security!

 CRYPTO:

 Event Structure:This event will contain answer for a certain question and the contestants will have to guess the best question. The best question which is most probable to the actual question will be selected

 Round 1: • Different questions for first and second year

 • Only Subjective questions

 • Top 10 from first year and top 10 from second year

 • Duration : 2 hours for 15-20 questions

 Round 2: • Some codes will be given and the participants will have identify what the code is for

 • Top 2 from first year and top 2 from second year

 • Duration : 1.5 hours for 10-15 questions

 Registration Fee: Rs. 30

 Coordinators: Himanshu (CSE)

 Aditya Parasar (CSE) 8865009044

 Piyush Sharma (CSE)

 Shivani Gupta(CSE)

‘Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the universe is winning.’ - Rick Cook. Are you one of those who loves problem solving and competing. Are you one of the those who feels like coding is fun? Are you are one of those who always algorithmize their tasks. Or maybe, you think to segment tasks in order to reduce your workload. If you find yourself in this league, then this contest is just for you Structure: The entire event is an online coding event managed and organized in association with Codechef. Also, the prizes and goodies will be given by Codechef. No need of any venue as the event is an online event.

 Registration Fee: Free.

 Coordinators: • Maulik Verma (IT)

 • Risham Pansari (IT) 9415533435

 • Raja Babu (IT)

 • Abhishek Patel (IT)

ELECTRONICS + TRADING

 Technology and business are becoming inextricably interwoven. I don’t think anybody can talk meaningfully about one without talking about the other"- Bill Gates


Event Structure: This is the multiple round ‘on the spot’ event, in which 1st round is a theoretical MCQ test based on electronics and aptitude and every correct answer earns the participant a virtual money. Using this money participants will move in further rounds, where they will buy components and make the listed electronic circuits on bread board in a given time. Once a team completes the circuit , it can then sell the circuit, in return of more virtual money. A team can again buy new components and build a new circuit and sell it to earn the money. The team which has the maximum money at the end of predefined time is winner.

 Rounds:Event has two rounds.

 No of participants:Team of two members.

 Difficulty:Difficulty level for 1st and 2nd year students is different.


Registration Fees:Registration charges ₹40/ participant. • Prize money depends on number of participation.


Coordinators: • Akanksha Singh (ECE)

 • Akriti Srivastava (ECE)

 • Nitish Singh (ECE) 7355437239

 • Gaurav Srivastava (ECE) 8299708469

 • Mahima Singh (ECE)

What is the use of skills if you don’t have any platform to perform on. ElectroMatrix brings you a platform to use your electronic enthusiasm to create another hero in your gaming world. Do or do not there is no try. This year also ElectroMatrix provides you to explore your creativity. Tickling your brain cells to design an electronic circuit is what gives satisfaction then polish your skills ,revise your stuff to design some mind boggling electronic circuits.

 This is event will have two rounds, in which the 1st round will consist of objective type questions testing the participant’s knowledge on basic electronics and aptitude. According to the scores secured in the first round, 8 teams will qualify for the 2nd round. The 2nd round will test the software skills of the team in which the participants will be designing circuits on NI-MultiSim Software. The first team to design the correct circuit will be declared as the winner. The participants are expected to have some prior knowledge about working on the NI-MultiSim Software. Nevertheless the qualifying teams of the 1stroundwill be given a short tutorial teaching them about the software.

 • Event has two rounds.

 • Team of two members.

 • Difficulty level for 1st and 2nd year students is different.

 • Registration charges ₹40/ participant.

 • Prize money depends on number of participation.

 • Ananya Panwar (ECE)

 • Yashi Rastogi (ECE)

Well, for us engineers nothing is a waste. We know how to make something useful from scrape material and this is exactly what this event is all about –Utilizing waste to materials to make something innovative and interesting. TechnoSpandan 18 gives you a wonderful opportunity to showcase your waste management skills and unleash the Engineer in you for the betterment of mankind.


Registration Fee : Rs 40 per person One Group consists of 5 to 6 members. Participating groups have to make working model from the things given to them. No group is allowed to take any other things other than the things provided to them.

 Timing – 2 to 4 pm

 Venue – workshop After completion of project students will be present them in front of the judges. The judges will unanimously decide the winner.

The "Baap" of all quizzes. This one promises to be a vicious affair. ‘Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.’ - Trust your instinct, use your knowledge and awareness and aim for victory. Be there to experience the joy of working out a question from scratch, the disappointment when you get it wrong and that epic feeling of being crowned champion! Be there to fight it out to be the best college-quizzer! Registration fee: 50 per head.

 Rules and regulations :

 1. Participation is restricted to a team of 2 or less people. Cross college teams are allowed

 2. The quiz consists of a written elimination round followed by on stage finals for 6 qualifying teams.

 3. The finals structure will be decided by the quizmaster

 4. The decision of the quizmaster will be final and binding

Event Description:

 First round: In this around the participants will have to submit an abstract of 500 words explaining their ideas and its viability.

 Second round: In this round the shortlisted contestants will have to explain theirs ideas through a power point presentation of about 8-10 minutes.

 No. of Participants: Maximum two participants can be in one team

 Registration fees: Rs.50 per head

 Second round: The shortlisted students will be called for personal interview.

 The participants will form a team of 2, the fee being ₹40/- per member.

 First round would be preliminary round having a general paper on aptitude analysis.

You think you can sell! You think you can convince! Then prove yourself through this event. This event is all about it. Ad War requires the participants to be creative and develop a marketing Strategy for a product. Students will perform an advertisement and thus present their advertising ideas. The best idea will bag the title of AD-KING. 

 Event Structure: 

 Registration Fee: ₹ 30 

 No. of Participants : 3-6 

Round 1: Ad Test This round will serve the purpose of testing the general awareness of common brand taglines of the participants. Only 2 members are allowed from each team. 

Round 2: Sell YOUR Product The advanced teams will be given 3 minutes on stage to sell their own predecided product through a prepared advertisement. 

Round 3: Sell OUR Product Team selected from the round 2 will now be vying for the top honours and would be given 20 minutes to make an advertisement on the product given by the event coordinators. Winners will be declared after this round. 

 COORDINATORS:

 Shashank (9169379783)

 Amit Singh (7678983861)

You can give witty replies!You can hold a group of people by your words? So welcome to this competition, you"re indeed tailor made for it. And to those introverts like me, its time to show your peers that you are indeed made for the lime light by competing and winning this competition.

 Event Structure:

 Registration fee: ₹ 30

 The event comprises of two rounds:

 Round 1:

 Preliminary Round In this round the interested participants will be asked to present a piece of their writing on the basis of which the selected participants will be allowed for the next round.

 Round 2: On Stage In this round, winners will be declared on the basis of their complete performance, content and expressions. The decision of judges will be final.

The students who are interested in participating in ‘’The Voice Battle’’, have to pass an audition round. The students have to appear for an audition, along with their karaoke. And participants also can perform on guitar. Duet performances will also be considered for the competition. The auditions will take place in 2 rounds. Maximum selected participants will be 20 Time limit for a performance -3 minutes

 Registration fees -30 Rs.

 only Levels of battle The First level – all the participants will perform on stage. After the elimination, qualified participants will go on to the second level. The Second level - after performing, further elimination will take place and qualified participants will proceed to the third level. The Third level – this will be the final round, after which the winners will be declared.

 Venue -All the performances will take place at lecture hall one.

This event will be organized in three categories, Solo, Duet, and Group where participants will first go through an elimination round (Audition) being judged by the Organizing Team and a Cultural head. The selected Candidates will then Face Off one of their Competitor in a heated Dance Battle to move to the finals and the remaining will be given a chance to Re-Enter the competition by performing their Dance routine in front of Teachers or Organizing Team.

In this event participants will be given topics on the basis of current political or economical condition. Time span of 20 minutes will be provided to write in favour or against of the provided topic. First chance will be given to the opposition to ask questions in first 1 minute. Then chance to the government will be given to clarify their points convincingly introducing their policies within 2 minutes. After this chance will be given to opposition to counter the government and enquire about required changes.

In this event participants will project their acting skills. Each registered team can have 5-10 participants who have to present 8-12 minutes of moralistic play. The team will best acting skills, moral and closeness to their theme will be awarded.

It is said that it is important for us to know how to carry ourselves in public with grace and confidence and this event is all about expressing oneself in public.This is the trademark for a successful fashion model and so this event is for our future models who’ll set the stage on fire. Beauty with brains is a rare combination and indeed, difficult to find. So in this event we will be on our quest to find those special ones. Event Structure: Audition will be taken for the students who are willing to participate in this event. Auditions will take place in two rounds. Ramp walk. Quick Introduction General questioning Maximum 12 students will be selected.

 Registration fee : ₹ 50

 Rounds: 

Round 1: Ramp Walk Students will be selected on the basis of expressions, attitude and walk.

 Round 2: Quick introduction In this a 2 minutes introduction is needed from the student on the basis of which confidence and expression will be analysed. Round 3: General Questioning On the basis of the form filled by the students questions will be asked. IQ and attitude will be checked.

 COORDINATORS:

 Rohan Singh (7309400273)

 Ramsha Alam (7081790193) 

Shubhi Verma Anushka Singh

Interested participants are required to go through audition with their poem or shayaris.  Registration Fee: ₹ 30 per head.

 Number of participants: 1-3

 Event Structure: This is a single round event where teams will be given a certain amount of virtual currency at the beginning of the contest. Companies will be listed with a certain rating value and base price and auction of that company will start off between the teams. Naturally team with highest bid gets to keep the company. Teams having zero companies at the end of the first fifteen minutes would be disqualified from the event. At the end of the bidding round the team with the highest number of rating points will be declared a winner.

ELIMINATION ROUND: 1. This round will be of 20 minutes.

 2. Each player will be given 30 seconds for his move, if he fails, +1 will be awarded to the opponent.

 3. Player with the maximum points at the end of the game will be chosen as the winner.

 After each round the players for the next round will be selected by random draw.

 SEMI-FINAL and FINAL ROUND:

 1. This round will be of 25 minutes.

 2. Each player will be given 30 seconds for his move, if he fails, +1 will be awarded to the opponent.

 3. Player with the maximum points at the end of the game will be chosen as the winner.

 Chess piece relative value:

 1. Pawn - 1

 2. Knight- 4

 3. Bishop- 3

 4. Rook- 5

 5. Queen- 9

1. Team must have a minimum of 5 players including goalkeeper.

 2. Goalkeeper is not allowed to touch the ball by hands.

 3. No parts of the hand (below elbow) are allowed even for throw in.

 4. We do appreciate attacking play, defensive plays is not allowed therefore on each 5th corner conceded a penalty will be awarded.

 5. For a foul play if the referee deems necessary he can give a greencard to the player where the player will not be included in the game for 2 minutes.

 6. On the 2nd greencard the player will be immediately given a redcard.

 7. A straight redcard can also be awarded if deemed necessary.

 8. In case of conflicts Referee’s decision will be final decision.

 9. There will be 2 halves each of 15 minutes with 5 minutes break in between the halves.

 Entry Fee- Rs.250 per team

 Quasim Sami(ECE) +91 88 53 868193

1. Each game will be played for 15 points.

 2. The edges of the table are part of the table surface.

 3. If the ball touches the top of the net and goes over and onto the table, there will be no point scored and the server will serve again.

 4. Each player will serve 2 points alternately.

 5. If a game reaches 14 all, each player serves 1 point alternately until the game is won by 2 clear points.

 6. A point will be lost if a player fails to hit the ball onto their opponents side.

 Entry Fee- Rs.30

 Co-ordinators

 Rishabh Gupta(MEE) +91 78 60 194659

1. Each game will be played for 7 points.

 2. Player will score a point at the end of each rally.

 3. At the beginning of the game (0-0) and when the server’s score is even, the server serves from the right service court. When the server’s score is odd, the server serves from the left service court.

 4. It is not a fault if you miss the shuttle while serving.

 5. The faults in the game will be when:

 • The shuttle does not land in the correct service court.

 • A serve or shot that lands outside the court boundaries passes under or through the net, touches any other obstructions or a player’s body or clothing. The boundary and service lines are considered in play.

 • Hitting the shuttle twice in succession by a player or team.

 • A player touching the net or its supports with his body or racket while the shuttle is in play.

 6. The inner line will be considered as the game line.

 7. In case of conflicts Referee’s decision will be final decision.

 Entry Fee- Rs.40

 Co-ordinators

 Ashutosh Singh(ECE) +91 94 51 671299

 Arti gupta (MEE)

 Ananya Panwar(ECE)

 2. The game will be played in two halves of 15 minutes each with 5 minutes break in between the halves.

 3. If a team is not present at the allotted time, the other opponent team will be declared winner.

 4. All other standard rules of basketball will be followed.

 5. In case of conflicts Referee’s decision will be final decision.
